column4: Hi... is there a chance of this bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/evolution-data-server/+bug/151536 - damaging the hardware of a machine?
only if your machine is already undercooled
- One overheats due to the room its in. The other is a laptop which has to run the fan continuously then eventually switches off due to heat.
ya, that'd be a design defect in the laptop, which isn't helped by that bug :p
- It doesnt do it on Gusty/Windows...
if it's shutting down, then it should be okay (as long as you don't keep powering it back up), in that the hardware has a thermometre to shut down the machine before it _actually_ overheats
they're journalled, in practice there shouldn't be any data corruption (although obviously anything that hadn't been written to disk yet is gone)
that being said, a hard shutdown isn't exactly nice to the hardware either
and whether an application itself handles being killed nicely is another matter
- Was unavoidable, Ubuntu totally froze, could switch to terminals or anything
incidently, if that happens again, you can avoid the worst behaviour sometimes
alt-sysrq-s will do a disk sync, which will save you from some harm
alt-sysrq-[reisub] (r, then e, then i... a few seconds between each)
- I think it had completely given up though, but will make a note of that for next time :)
